projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,363 texts created during Phase 1 of the project have been released into the public domain as of 1 January 2015. Anyone can now take and use these texts for their own purposes, but we respectfully request that due credit and attribution is given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).

Full documentation of the original data capture process is available from the Text Creation Partnership web site. All versions of the texts are now archived and freely available for download. See the TCP Download FAQ for detailed information. The TEI P5 versions are also freely available from the TCP Github repository.

div.head: THEAVRAU IOHN HIS EPITAH And EVROPS Looking-glass.
div.p: Brethren the Divine light hath taken its Regency in the Son •• of men, and from God is this Divine guift; ORI AL, that is this lig •• angel: this Angel light come, to enlighten the darke world in man, or have stated a conjunctive word which is this Mikrakessoamoas, th •• is thus defined or Englished; it is somthing lovely inclosed in darkness, which the Spirit of God in man, and from that light which is rhe first fruites un •• God, is that received and declared and sounded forth, for the sound go ••• before the Judgment cometh.

Now Light is the declarer of Darknesse, & Darknesse is the accuser of ligh • for in strength there is no accusation but sin and weaknesse is allwaies clam •
rous and accusing Now I Theaurau Iohn come in the HIPOSTICAL ALLI the English is this; The Searcher for darknesse in the Rooted Root the ANTE-VIA, or the before way, them two lattin words as they stand
•• e Sate; their definition is unfathomable, for in their significatory Extent, •• ey exclud the Heriscope, and reach into ALLAH HOIRE define them • ords, and then you may behould Theavrau Iohn in the Inmost Temple, • here there is no voyce but behoulding, and no speaking nor expressing, for •• at is vanity which is the clothing of mortality. O! ACKKLAH-SABIE,
•• e English is this; O! thou Shutter in thy rest, thy prisonre in his birth,
•• ussrharim arni pelah aluah horat o • , the English, is O! England, O! England, • y Rootes are searching into, by that Eye that cannot be deceived; for thy • niquity is great, great, great, before my God, and a Watchman, & an Hewer, • set against thee to preach thy Funerall, for thou art Dead though thou • inkest thou art a live.

O! Ye that are the accounted Eyes, directors, and Seeres for the people, • ow I come to try you; for if the Eye be dark, the body must be imperfect • sight; now what are ye, you answer, Ministers of the Gospell of Christ,
• ell. I am a Priest of the Law, and an Apostle in the Gospell, my expession is • raing, but on the event let the people Judge. Now I will give you my difini
•• on thus; I am a Priest called by that Eternall word, which word in his HORI
• PHE ARE it is ROKAS, that is the Strength, Word, Root, God, the Crea
•• r of all things; Now my demonstration is this, I am a Priest the first in this • ew birth, borne and brought forth form that radicall Root, which is Life, and • mmortality it selfe living in him selfe, behoulding him selfe in us, & wee in • im both Celestial Alliah Saby Ory Hesseon Or Oni Am

The English of this dubeous state is this, the doubtfull man wandereth till • he Center take him, then he seeth the fearfull vanity that he hath passed thorough, which is the Eye of the Priest, for the Priest is the Eye of the Law, the Law
〈◊〉 the life of the Priest, so then heere you have in the Priest the Law, and the Law the Priest, what is this I answer it is the Reserrection of God in man, man made obedient to God by that light, that he hath received from God, that light
• s Gods Law wrot in the heart of the Priest, the Priest is the Eye in that • aw, what is an Eye, it is sight, what is sight, it is Obedience, what • s Obedience, it is Love, what is Love, it is Life, what is Life, it is Jehovah 〈◊〉 Aluah Hoarim, then to be a Priest in the Law, it is to be in Jehouah, which is the Life of the Law, and God himselfe. So much for my definition in my Essoyne or in my Priest Office by, or in the Law.

Now I come an Apostle in the Gospell which is Massah, or Jesus; Appostalie Regie Adma Hosaret Regina Via Eorum; the english is this the, Appostles are Christs Reserrection of this Regnecy, who by him are one in him by light from God, so when Paul and the rest knew the Reserecton of Jesus; then the beggerly Rudiments were cast by as Childishness, then their was a going on unto
perfection which is the spheare I move in, and not in a poore clay house, in wh •• the beauty Excelency did appeare, I meane that body that Suffered at Ierus •
lem, Cristus Non Dia Sed, Viva Vita in Rens Magih, the english, is Christ is not Appearing day, and then night; but a living life of greatness. and Excelenc •
Now Brethering I beseech you observe these two Maximes. 1. God could 〈◊〉 be man, for man is a thing created and made, and that cannot be God; but G •• is he that made and Created that Appearing thing, which we call man; for wh • is borne of flesh is flesh, though to give, your you owne Conception, or Conceiving Jesus in your owne Bookes, yet doe you, & the whole world know that Mary, that • say was the Mother of God, if your expression be true, she can be noe lesse, an • I beseech you remenber she Mary; I meane, was but flesh, and what is borne flesh is flesh, so saith the true Scripture, and flesh and blood cannot Inhear •• eternall Life; now know that he that was born of Mary was flesh and in that flesh. Borne of her did Jesus appeare; for Jesus is n • nor never was an out side body, but an inmost or inward annointing that Crusifies by his Subjecting poewr, the out side man unto Obedience unto t •• inside or inmost spirit, for no man can see Jesus but by the effects; for Jes •• is a spirituall annointing, and not a visible Carnality: But Jesus is the subdue of Carnallity to the Divinity, being ressident in the Carnall forme, which Devi •• or Divinity is the harts Senter, in which it is made upright, and actions anser •
ble to the Senter doth issue into the Declarations. One instance I give touchi •• the Carnality of Jesus as you acknowledg and it is this, it is said that Jes •• offered up a willing Sacrifice for us; this is true but look into the very wor • them selves and they are these; for Roome hath not shut in th • translation all the light out, but the Eye of light doth discover betwixt to joynts in the closure of that Gospel; now here is the light that descovers th • cheat Couched in these words, and implyed the quit contrary to the tru • meaning of the Spirit, these are the words FATHER if it be thy will that th • Cup may pass from mee: why I beseech you bretheren for the mercy sake consider rightly, for these was none of your Saviour Jesus his words as you literaly understand; but these ware and are Jesus his words, not my will but t • will be done, and submitted, for Jesus is the power of God submitting m • unto himself. The second maxim is this, God is a spirit, Jesus is the same: and my Father am on, it was not that appearance neither, that sound or voy •
that was one with the father; but it was the tye life, or life tye, that is the Obedient Essence in man made light, which light cannot be spoken, for it is spirituall behoulding, that spirituall behoulding that' Euen that; was it th • was one with the Father, that and the Father are one, and not a man nor
yee, neither any apperance, but that, that is one with the Father; it is ORY •• L that is the light all, the all light, & that light is the living life moveing in all •• at are risen in the Jesus Reserriction which is MOVNT SION. So when you •• e come unto mount Sion, then you will know what I write; for my Sheep •• y k • ow me, and my voyce is the Crown of their Lovely injoyment, for let •• e tel you you, you darke Gentiles, it is a voyce runing in the Vaines of life
•• thering us all into one, one into all; for in light there is bvt one, and wee in one another, and all in God by that free gift of his grace given unto us reconcile us one to annother, and so all to God.

Now ye Ministers of the Gospell in England I come to try you by the
•• spell, now take this in the first place, all truth is but one Gospell, for there is
〈◊〉 truth & deceipt or alye, in the whole world, althouge demonstrated vari
•• sly in various forms and fashions. Now the first queerie is this.

How can you Propagate the Gospell, when you know not the Gospell. I proove thus, in that word Propagating the Gospell, yee doe not know the Gospell; for yee were in the Gospell, or knew the Gospell, then you would know that it is • ods free gift and mercy, not comming by meanes or endeavor: But Gods •• e gift Conferrd without mans desert, on whom the Lord pleaseth. I pray •• u now where is your Propagating the Gospell; the way that leads to the
•• spell is Christs light, and that casts out Covetousness, that's the first step; for •• uetousness is the Root of all evill, & that Root is so deeply Rooted in you
•• eists or Ministers of the Gospell, and also as deeply Rooted in the States of the •• nd; that that glory, Gospell, or Gospel, glory arises in another people, for that • or Covetousness (Exce) unroots you, both Priests, and Stats, for being rooted the Gospell.

The Second queery it is, Affirmative prooving that you never knew the •• spell. nor the Stats, nor the called Parliament, neither of you both. I prove it •• s; The Gospell is Peace, yee are in Warr, and provokers to Warr, there: in •• m Spirits, the Gospell was never rooted, (Id est) primus Makxzi.

How how did yee Priests thunder in your trade of lyes, in these expressions, • hat was not for the Gospell let him be accursed, and he that would not •• t for the Gospell was none of Christs, was not this your Baal trade of lyes?
〈◊〉 you bin Preists of the Law, then you might have had some Colour to •• e Acted under: But you are as yee call your selves, Ministers of the •• spell, and if you be Ministers of the Gospell, so is Appollion or the Deuill; for •• s the root yee grow upon, I proove it thus from your own words, he •• t would not goe & fight for the Gospell could not be one of Christs flock, you remember this Cheat you put upon the poore Innocent & Ignorant
people? now in them words their lyes a perfect deniall both of Christ and 〈◊〉 Gospell, For Christ and his Gospell is peace in love; & love in peace & know al p ••
ple that Peace is not Warr, & love is not in slaying one another, for your ow •
selfe ends, and your hooke baited to take the simple innocent men with th • Baite Gospell. But as the Lord lives ye shall drinke deep of your Fornicationus co ••
that you have bewi • ched, & foxed, & made the Nation drunke withall; for yo • day is at hand which you through the Eye of your Sophestry perceive th • makes you two theevish lyars, bring your difference • to beare a face of bein • reconciled both into one, and it is but thus much yet Priests, in the truth o • your intentions it is, because you see your trade begins to decay, & the colou • of propagating, the Gospel may from the States procute a humain •• forme, & s •• a Law to bind men in obedience to that forme, when indeed it is your designe o • strenghten your selves by that Law obtained in your trad of lyes, and so 〈◊〉 hold the people in obedience unto your selves, and this is your sole an • whole end and aime in the propagating of the Gospell.

Thus know all people that a Law may be given to cause the outward man to walk formable; but no man can give a Law to cause obedience in the inward spirit, for that is Spiritual and Gods place of Regency, he that will forme • a law, for that; he is the Highest and Greatest Antichrist that ever was; fo • he assum • s unto himself Gods Royalty of Regency.

So then make you a law, for that which is lawable, that is the outward man, and make it as strait as you will in all points; for they in whom the life of Christ is truly rison they will fulfill it; for know love doth no evil to any man, but lives in its own Behoulding, and in that Behoulding it rejoyce • continualy. So then you see the Jewes are obedient unto your Lawes o • your Land, then do not you force a Formall Cheate called Relig • on, upon the people; for it will prove the highest Idolatry that ever arose, that upon the Resurrection of light you will put a darke decevable vaile, but yee are like your fore-Fathers; for they persecuted the light, and so do you.

Now I come to Charge the States of the Land, and unto them I shall but name their own Words, and them Words confirmed by Oathes, and the gre ••
Jehovah called to witness what they Protested unto; now comes the •
Tryall that Tryes you all: Now if you be in the Truth what you seemed, nay Sayd, nay Sworne unto, you cannot be offended at your own Oathes proceeding from your own lips, and the Invocation of Jehovah to beare Record, and know that he is the true Record of all your actions. The first was for the Gospell, O! how would you defend that; now known yea Stats that the Gospell containes in it all Truth and Holiness which you said would be destroyd,
and Popery brought in; all this cheat I remember, but then I was not •• rought in to light; for know by your standing to defend the Gospell, you Declare you know not the Gospel, for the Gospel cuts down all standing in • an, and upon the death of mans own standing the Gospel is planted, & Rooted;
• or mens Death is the Gospels life. Now in the Gospel there is no feare of Popery, for the true Gospel is that holy Annoynting that turnes Popery, and Independancy, and Presbtery, & Anabaptistery, & Armininisme, and the rest of these dark deceipts into one light which is the Gospel, and then all these Sects are unsected & made one light, which is but still the Gospel, the word Gospel, the true English that it holds in its Imbodiment, it is thus much derived from the Word Gospel, it is Gods Saved, or Gods Chosen, so much lies in the Word Gospel. The Hebrew word radical is KIO wrot in 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
KOF not 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
CAPH, for KOF signifies strength in knowledg, now had this strength of knowledg been • n you, you had stood in the rooted root, but because this root Knowledg or Knowledg root, was not in you, that causes alwayes Feare, and from Feare all evil. Actions proceeds, and feare is not Love. Then their is no light, but darknesse consists, from whence comes all these Cheating Declaratiues unto, • and upon the Nation? it is from this state of feare, I prove it thus, God is
• ove, feare is hate, light is love, love is light, darknesse is hate; so then love is the Law of God; feare and darknesse is the law of the Divill, and this is the State you lye in; that makes you to say and unsay, sweare and for sweare, promise and desceive, protest and in that protest, intend to Cheate

The next, was for the Liberty of the Subject, and the Law of the Land; Now I come into your own root, to Argue with you, and in your own Method of words, but your Actions are murderors of your words, probatum • est from your Declaratives; Now the law in truth of law in his intent,
• t is to right all men: and indeed it is right to all men if its motion, be in its own wheels, for know an Administrator of the Law, he is to sound the Law in the Laws own words and terms, both in intent and extent, and the Administrator of the Law is to be onely a Pipe in which the consent and Agrement of the People is to pass through, and be he what he will be, Great or
•• wall that sounds not the Law so; he is a Traytor to the Law and People present, and ought to dye without mercy, because he becomes a contemner of the Conjunctive meaning of the People, and gives his own will for the true Law of the Land; but when truth arises and calls, the Administrators of Justice to an account, which day is not far off; our eyes shall see it performed, and • n that day there will be made many places of Judicature empty, This I know; and all yee people that are oppressed, be yee comforted, even yee which we
our selves call Cavaleers; For as the Lord lives ye shall have a true Demostration of Right, in Waight, and measure don unto you; But NO KING but by the power of the Lord, changing men, for though ye have bee •
openly prophane, and delghters in vanity, for that hath the Lord scourged you but we, even we, are more theivishly wicked, for we have not only slain ou •
Enemies, but cheated our Friends, and brought the state of perjury upon th • whole al altogether, that intrusted us, and have made ourselves the Scorn •
of Nations, the cheat of the people, the Abstract of all cruel villany,

I demonstrate from my Light thus; First, We covenanted and sword to that, then we unswore that and never performed it, which yet shall stand to the rooting out of all self-seeking men in the Nation, out, out, out, by the roots, and a Wolf, man, a man Wolf that is a Devourer of his Brother, he shall not be left to inhabit amongst us; This is a strange saying wrot, But it is from trve light.

Now know the Conjuncture of the people, if by them it have a being, It is the beauty, excellency, glory, honour and honesty celectd out of their whole all, altogether; This so chosen, is the Representative of all their glory, in whom their trust and confidence is reposed. Now this so chosen, and so seated, it is in England called a Parliament,

Now I hope I shall offend none that now sits, for I speak in the truth of the Nations, true birth-right linially discending, duely conjoyned, and of right chosen, Magna Charta being their foundation-stone or Center. Now if yee be offended by thar, I know you to be but shaddows, for if ye be t • ve, then no offence; for it is a shadoe or weakness that is jeolous or offended, for truth is strong standing Centered in the main rock, which is God, for God is Truth who hath been made a Colour to colour all your false, falices under, & for his glory alone I contest with this Nation only to charge it with the works wrought in it, then my work here is done, for judgement follows the sound, but men by the sound shall be left without excuse.

Now once more ye States have wronged me and my choise in the Parliament for which I ought to be satisfied, thus; My choise, I chose I faithfully stood to defend, till a choise was chosen by a stronger hand, which violated my choyce and how many more I know not; but this I know, that in that chousing, was not the Law, nor the righr of the Nation included, but then our Servants became our Masters and Lords ouer us, violating all our birth rights, Law and Liberty, the which things they before had Covenanted in solemne Oath to maintain, calling God to witness, who (as I said before) is a • tive witness bearer, and this I know, he will Rase out all Perjury out from
amongst us, for God, will purge, till a peculiar people come forth, that shal • read your Idols of Gold & silver, & Lands & Esteeme, that esteeme is a great Idol in England; But this people that God will raise, shal tread all these under their feet, not esteeming that which you onely worship, overthrowing all that you sowre to maintain, onely advanceing yourselves, by the same law and way that you have condemned others to death for, therefore I beseech you remember, he that puteth another to death, and he himself doth the same things that he condemned the other to death for, doth not he give sentence against himselfe? I pray you whome these words concerne, Remember and repent and returne. For know there is no transgression before there be a law, onely in England is this iniquity found, as a girdle girt upon her loines, & wo woe! woe unto this hypocriticall Nation, this all tounged Nation But de • ds of mercy in her are not found, the glory of her beauty is so bewitched for and with gain that her faith, her oathes, her covenants, and all her protesting, Calling God to witnesse is become a trade to be bought and sould for 3 s, 4 d a pound, which is the Laborours wages, your brethren the Lords workmen, whom you have thus deceived, And your selves the purchasors of your own willfull fallen Credits, and the Nations honour also, If ever they intrusted you with it; mistake me not, there is honest Godly men, but they are in minority and overcome by woluish plotters, whose hands Gods Judgment will find out, and bring them to their due desert; mistake me not, I am none of your Sects, I am a Jew both outward, and inward, a Priest; What is that? It is indeed the light raised out of the Gentiels dark root, for to charge the transgression upon the land, and to make it culpable before my God, that Judgement might enter upon his throne, for heavy days, and days of mourning for Iniquity is at hand, and though the Priests condemne the Astrollagers, take this from me, that am a man vnlearned in any art or tongue, Arki, Vea, • rni, Ophrat. Al, Sabi, Arni, Ory Alpha, Am, O Threapha, Alba Army Arrat.

The English is this Harke, I hear a crying sound of Confusion in the land, the Priests dispise the Creation of God, which is the Signes of the Firmament, which signes are the true, truth, in Gods writing-table, and are the true readings, unto men from God, that is the English from that conjoyned abstracted language into one canjunctive radical root.

A word unto ye Priests; first know you are confuted in your Clamouring, by this argument. If ye were able to define the Dictatings of the Stars in their several oprative motions, then knowledge it self would silence you; but in this appears your madness, to condemne the maxim, that the Root
Root you are not able to discover, or rase to 〈…〉 clear perspicuous Demonstrative; therefore it is madness beyond oppression, 〈◊〉 you to sentence, a thing you understand not. Let me tell you, Ora sam selex si vea sabini in rem; the meaning is this, The Hand pointeth to the Dial, but the Dial returneth not to the Hand, because the Hand is motional, the Dial fixed; So take notice, a Seal is set to a Bond, it is quikly done, and the Insert, is locked up, but there many times proves much sighing a •
〈◊〉 to 〈…〉 Bond in again; thus it is with man. But I state it allusive or allegories 〈◊〉 pointing to a higher Illustrative, that is, Gods Seal never alters, for his 〈…〉 truth, it stands firm.

Now ye, despisers and wonderers, it is the want of wisdome that causes you to asperse; but be ye sure, before the revocation of the inscalment, denoted by the conjunction, of or in, this Eclipse, it will be lamentable, wofull, and great mourning and devastation: So that he that is exempted from sorrow in this conjunction concerned, he must be Celestial, for no lesse will be security unto any: Then your forms of Religious Holiness that Cheat, will vanish as the untimely Birth of a woman; for a tryal for flesh and fleshliness will from Heaven be demonstrated, then shall ye Iews my people, be brought sorth as the refined of the Lord, fit to be possessed, ye being weighed up from the earth, or the earth weighed from you; for until the tincture of Evil be cast forth, Righteousness cannot be acted; for we must be delivered from, before we can be interested in. Selah.

O my Brethren, I your Brother Ruben (Theaurau Iohn) have declared my received of the Lord, which is the Tryumphant State, that the Iews here shall be possessed in their return, God will manifest his auncient Glory, and in that very peece and parcel of ground that hath had its Sabbaths of sorrow, tim • s time, and the half time, witnessed by Daniel my brother, by the dictatings of the Spirit in him, and the rest of the Prophets so long ago. Brethren, I am as a woman in strong travel for your birth which is to be brought forth; but beloved my God hath comforted me, for he hath shewed me this figure, that strength is in thee, from himself, and that thou commest forth like strength, birth, birth, strength, even comparatively, as a Child in the Womb, by t •• strength of his arms, should open the Matrix in which he is locked, and come forth in Majesty. So even, so, my beautious Brethren, I see you comming. O Hallelujah Samoas arby • ory Celestialis sabinai
〈…〉
naim; O? peace is thy loveliest Garment, that thy 〈…〉 withal, and nothing shall be wanting, to make thee th •
〈…〉
Beauty, and Princeliest, Princesses of all the pro ••
〈…〉
promised unto thee; the time, the time, the time is come, thy Shepheard and Watchman beholdeth thy beautious Inheritance, it is Naim, naim, naim, it is Arki naim felexsi or, it is Arma horaiah saby ad te; there is no English that can denote these states in their full import, but the Maximes will be Eclipsed in their Beauty, onely I give you this hint, it is, Glory, glory, glory to the twelve Tribes, but now in this return thirteen Tribes, we are increased in the North, as my next Book, which is already wrote, it doth illustrate.

Now all people, whereas I wrote an Epistle in which I challenged the lying Cle • gy of England, upon the 5 of April in Pauls Church, offering a fair dispute unto them, at which place, I was in the morning, and put up my bill signifying to appear at three of the clock that day, in the mean time the seduced spirits had obteined strength and power, to shut the doors and keep the people out, so when I came the doors was shut; now hear I shall claim my priviledge, as a free man of this City, and all the rest in my right included. First know you that we chose no private Congregation, but the Cathedral, a place free for all men and nations to meet in, and you know that there is an act of Parlament so called that authorizeth us to meet, and dispute, and confer; now here I see you deny the act to be in force, and so unto us it is made nul and void, so in this case of liberty the act stands us in no more force then an Almanack of the year last past; now my Lord Mayor and the rest of our Governours: if we meet in peace by authority of law, you are bound to proserve and keep us in peace, by your oath you have taken to the State, for know you, you are but servants unto them you receive from, and are intrusted in, you are to punish abusers of the peace and liberty of the people, and to maintain the peaceable people in peace with all your might and assistance.

And the main query is, whether I and the rest of the free-men of London, did contrary to our birth right, law, and liberty, by the State given unto us, if we kept within compasse (then;) but brethren what I offered then, I am the same, and will make my words good before all the people at any time, which words were, to prove the Clergy the greatest cheaters and deceivers, theeves, and robbers, in the whole earth, let them plot against mee what they can 〈◊〉 same I will prove unto their faces, if they dare appear; but know by this non- 〈◊〉
〈…〉
•• ing that a ly is with them; for if they were in light then they would be 〈…〉
love, they would have appeared to admonish my weakness,
〈…〉 have made good my challenge against them: but it is 〈…〉 : Now Priests that latine doth not please you, 〈…〉
•• ol is night in himself, and dare not come to the
light. Madad El, is not that Hebrew, what thi •
〈…〉 the English the • I understand neither Latine nor Hebrew, 〈…〉
•• ish; of 〈◊〉
Madad El, God sees darknesse is a Cave?
〈…〉 why 〈…〉 , that are you Priests, or Ministers of the Gospel; for you are the Ca • o
•• hath swallowed, how many I am not able to define, satis.

p.hi: Ori el arki sab oli Arma Nephushim aga zim a Saphel Arma Hoari • sab avaran hushi vertat.

div.p: To conclude all in this Hebrew state, it is this, the reason that you act so wickedly you Christians, it is because you have gotten the Apostles dead litterall expressions, contained in their writings which ye count the Gospel, and into them dead names you have formed your selves; but the Apostles they were that converted substance, from whence your name Gospel did proceed.

They knew in the holy light, the divine truth which truth was their souls center, and from that light received, the holy life sanctified did proceed, and from their souls centered, and their life sanctified, did that sound, which ye call the Gospell proceed, now ye have taken the sound, Gospel, from their words, and without the life that they lived the sound, it had been a ly, so you being but sounds, which sounds, without an holy life, is but a ly, and a deceipt, a dark Devill, and no better, being unchanged, the name Gospel is a ly, but the change Sanctity, and the life Purity, it is the root, life eternall planted in you, that is it, that makes you act in obedience, the reason that the • Apostles and the primitive Christians did walk so holily, it was the Gospel taking them in to it self) the reason that we live so wickedly, and almost all men Preachers, it is because we take the Gospell into us) now what man can take unto himself, it is but a name and a name is a ly, and this State is all you taking Gospellers in; for he whom the true Gospel takes, he is turned from covetousnesse, I prove the Gospell hath not taken you, because in covetousnesse ye remain, now in this small Tractate from that Hebrew state, is let down by the spirit of the Lord for a Looking-glasse for Europe, in which glasse they may see that they are but the Ideas of the true Gospel, for the shadows differs and contests, but truth binds all together in love, which is the light of God risen in man, and you may know what you want 〈…〉 thus deceitfully act.

Now hear I hope I shall offend none, for na •
〈…〉 they have done; for know if ye do judge me pun ••
〈…〉
things you your selves have done. What deserve you, that have done the ••• ngs, that you are offended to hear of the name. States, and people, in dark
••• s, they are but one darknesse to me; if not light, then you are dark, and that • e nation is sufferingly sensible of.
div.l: Vnto what I Write I subscribe my Name
And let me be fairly questioned, I will to your faces prove the same.

closer.signed: VVrote by me (Pheaurau Iohn) Taniour, of Eltham.

div.trailer:
FINIS.
seal
Theaurau Iohn tanyour High priest & recorder of ye 13 tribes of ye Iewes for ye Cap writes Returne
